snippet: Many deaths last week were attributed to toppled trees, and some arborists warn against overcutting of strong trees by fearful homeowners.
abstract: Arborists warn against overcutting and taking down of strong trees by homeowners frightened by the possibility of another hurricane like Sandy; professionals advise residents of New York region to exercise prudence and focus on keeping trees properly maintained and pruned rather than preemptively cutting them down.

byline.contributor:
Reporting on the storm was
contributed by Sam Dolnick,
Christopher Maag,
Daniella Silva and Kyle
Spencer.

lead_paragraph: Many deaths last week were attributed to toppled trees, and some arborists warn against overcutting of strong trees by fearful homeowners.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, N.Y. Region Mourns Fallen Trees
headline.main: Mourning Fallen Trees, Like Children to Some
headline.print_headline: Mourning Fallen Trees, Like Children to Some
